result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles L.W. Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution joint and several with co-defendant Scott Szerlong.

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

No contact direct or indirect with co-defendant Scott Szerlong and no contact direct or indirect with Trigs County Market and BP Cooper Oi.
Do not issue or negotiate any checks unless approved by probation agent.
Submit to DNA sample and any costs associated with that
$500 bond posted is to be applied against restitution first and then court costs.
Allow early discharge from probation if restitution is paid in full and conditions are complied with.
Probation may be transferred to Lincoln County.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles L.W. Davis in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:34 PM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Defendant is enroute.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court, received a message, Defendant delayed, will be here 10-15 minutes from now.

Case will be passed over for now, might get worked back in.

1:57 PM Court re-calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea at this time.

There is a plea agreement.

Defendant will plead to Count 1. Imposed/stayed prison, 3 yrs and 3 yrs, probation 3 years, costs, restitutuion j/s  $418.62, no contact S.Z. and trigs and BP, cooper oil, no checks, early discharge if recommended if restitutuion is paid, testify against co-defendant. Defendant will plead to Count 2. Imposed/stayed Prison, 3 yrs and 3 yrs, probation 3 yrs concurrent to Count 1, costs, same conditions. 

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Atty Drengler concurs.

Parties are prepared to go to sentencing.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Defendant concurs that he qualifies as a repeater.
Atty Drengler agrees. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: contrary to statute section stated therein  and 939.62(1)(b)
Count 2: contrary to statute section stated therein  and 939.62(1)(b)

No victims appear.

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court, requests bond money be applied. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court questions Defendant.
Address is verified.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Prison Sentence of 6 Years
3 Years Initial Confinement
3 Years Extended Supervision
Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 3 Years 
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay restitution joint and several with co-defendant Scott Szerlong $418.62 - Trigs County Market and Cooper Oil
No contact direct or indirect with co-defendant Scott Szerlong and no contact direct or indirect with Trigs County Market and BP Cooper Oil
Do not issue or negotiate any checks unless approved by probation agent
Submit to DNA sample and any costs associated with that
$500 bond posted is to be applied against restitution first and then court costs
Allow early discharge from probation if restitution is paid in full and conditions are complied with
Probation may be transferred to Lincoln County

Count 2:
Prison Sentence of 6 Years
3 Years Initial Confinement
3 Years Extended Supervision
Imposed and Stayed
Concurrent to Count 1
Probation for a period of 3 Years 
Concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Probation may be transferred to Lincoln County

ADDRESS INFO for Charles L.W. Davis
Current: N113 Hilly Road, Merrill, WI 54452 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2015)
Prior: 9296 State Cty Hwy 107, Athens, WI 54411 United States

3:53 p.m. Defendant Charles L.W. Davis in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Charles L.W. Davis in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
